rComments: The course (ERS103) is lecture heavy. Anything in red on his presentations/slides will be tested. Midterm and final exam have very similar formats in terms of style/format and content. Material itself isn't too hard to understand. Come to class and taking good notes is an easy way to get a good grade.

I took this course as a GPA booster, and to be honest, I really enjoyed it. This prof is great! He speaks out of passion. His powerpoint slides are long and detailed, but you can make good notes out of them. the assignments were a bit challenging, but he is not a hard grader. his tests were easy and straightforward. past tests are very helpful.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', 'Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: There was only one midterm and it was pretty straightforwards, make sure you understand the basic concepts. You didn't really need to show up to class as most of the information was on the slides posted online. Final was a bit tough, but reading over past exams was very useful and helpful.

He explains the content clearly and makes the midterm/exam extremely fair; you should be able to do really well if you study. The assignments on the other hand are marked BRUTALLY. On the plus side, he'll make a few jokes here and there during lectures which are actually funny.

I really enjoy his lectures, the stuff he teaches is interesting minus the topics about rocks. The writing assignments were marked fairly, I don't know why a lot of people were complaining about his marking style. Midterm was easy but the final exam was difficult.
writing assigments are marked hard tests are very easy
One of the better professors I have had throughout my experiences at uoft
